page.title: 08Galloway St. Leisure Gardens
page.content: Galloway Street Leisure Gardens are located in an area of old, terraced houses. Originally the site had empty, derelict houses on it. They were very frequently vandalised and often nearby tenants had to be evacuated in case of fire. In 1977 the Council knocked the houses down, but then the site became a dumping ground for rubbish. Some local residents, with the support of their M.P., Mr David Alton, asked for the land to be used as allotments. After two or three years the Council granted permission for the Gardens to be built for the benefit of the community. The land is divided into twenty-one plots, each with a licence renewable yearly. Fruit and vegetables are grown for home use or to give away. Flowers are grown and given to the old people, who also visit the Gardens.
